text: Hello, quick question, Oauth is a user-level or account-level, I mean it requires each user to grant access or one user only?

Hello.  I’m trying to set a value of a custom property within a custom property group. This isn;t working for me.  Am I doing this right?  Thank you!     `{`
      `"properties": {`
        `"firstname": "New",`
        `"adv_contact_information": {`
          `"advance_id": "0000316929"`
        `},`
        `"business_unit": "ADV",`
        `"email": "<mailto:newuser@test.com|newuser@test.com>",`
        `"lastname": "User"`
      `}`
formerly microsoft flow
I believe you can just put it at the top-level; you do not need to specify the group. Assuming `adv_contact_information` is the group name.

Hey <@U01MBAU8KU1> and <@U0177RKAS1H> - Ethan here, the PM of the Quotes product at HubSpot. Could you help me understand what specifically you’re trying to achieve using the Quotes API? Are you trying to add data, pull data out, etc. We’re working on the aPI right now and I’m trying to phase the rollout to release an MVP ASAP.

Hey guys

Have you found a way to display information from the "product" standard object in an email or a page? or is it more advised to create a custom object for that?

The use case would be to create abandoned cart emails or display a "you may also like these products" module

thanks!

On a page you can use the crm_objects hubl function to query the data - however, you’ll need to find a way to decide on what products to show. If this relationship/suggestion is generated externally you could just pass the product ids in via the URL.
ok thanks <@UQERM7BLY> and what about emails?
